column4: Hi All! I have to use SUN JDK 1.3.1 and when I run javah and javac I get :  error while loading shared libraries: libstdc++-libc6.1-1.so.2
Hi All! I have to use SUN JDK 1.3.1 and when I run javah and javac I get :  error while loading shared libraries: libstdc++-libc6.1-1.so.2 any tips?
I cann't use a new one :(
ah, i missed the 'have to use'
paste the output of 'ldd $(which javac)' (or whatever java app) on the pastebin (paste.ubuntulinux.nl)
I found that both javac and javah are symbolic links to a bash script that then excute: bin/i386/native_threads/javac
ok, any clues if you run ldd on that?
so the ldd on bin/i386/native_threads/javac is the following:http://paste.ubuntulinux.nl/5343
I have several version of Java installaed on my system  so I'm able to find more the on libjvm.so
do the bash scripts set the LD_LIBRARY_PATH environment variable ?
anyway the founed libjvm relate to jdk 1.3.1 are: /opt/java/jdk1.3.1_16/jre/lib/i386/client/libjvm.so
I installaed the packages libstdc++2.10-glibc2.2 and then I had to execute  sudo ln -s /usr/lib/libstdc++-libc6.2-2.so.3 /usr/lib/libstdc++-libc6.1-1.so.2
at least now I do not get the error and also no segmentation foult so I think that it's working :)
